product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Colorful Face Powders – Blush, Bronze, Highlight, & Contour
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content: Love this product! It is easy to apply and very buildable, I can add just a touch of colour on my cheeks or use it as a very pigmented eyeshadow. This colour compliments my skin and makes me look alive!!!

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Colorful Face Powders – Blush, Bronze, Highlight, & Contour
user_specs: ['Age 18-24', 'Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: I usually use Kevyn Aucoin contour powder but saw this and thought it might work as a dupe. In terms of color and tone, it is comparable but quality-wise, it is not. This contour applied well and has pigment to it, but it can be a little challenging to blend out and I find it does not have strong staying powder.

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Colorful Face Powders – Blush, Bronze, Highlight, & Contour
user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Black', 'Skin Tone Tan', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content: I have oily skin and this worked really well! Its not dusty like when you put it on, little creamy and blends well. Super pigmented too! If you are ballin' on a budget, this is the blush to use!

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Colorful Face Powders – Blush, Bronze, Highlight, & Contour

review_title: Nice color and finish, but hard to open!
review_content: The color is cute. I'm a light medium skin tone with warm olive undertones. It was the perfect coral that wasnt too bright, but it wears off pretty easily. I prefer my Nars to this. For the price, I'd say it's worth it if only the packaging was better.

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Colorful Face Powders – Blush, Bronze, Highlight, & Contour
user_specs: ['Age 25-34', 'Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Dry']
review_title: Color 35 is the perfect natural looking contour
review_content:
I purchased color 35 (Second Chance) as a contour and I LOVE it. I have really fair skin and every contour product I have tried (dozens of brands from luxury lines to drugstore buys) makes my skin look dirty or orange. This looks grey in the compact, but goes on my face perfectly. I barely even have to blend. It looks natural and gives my face definition and shape. If you want a super contoured full-makeup look, you could layer it or go with a different product, but if you are fair and want to look natural and pretty this is definitely for you.

review_content:

Within a couple of weeks of using it, the hinge on the case broke and slowly the entire case has fallen apart and disintegrated, so everytime I want to use it. The whole thing breaks apart. Its really annoying. If they even sold a solid cover for this, I would totally buy it and hot glue the blush disk into a new cover. Meanwhile, disappointed and annoyed and I don't really want to buy a new one of this brand for this reason.

user_specs: ['Age over 54', 'Eye Color Gray', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
This is a very nice shade of blush for me, I was looking for something like that for a while, and when I tried it in the Sephora store, I liked how natural it looked on my cheeks, and eventually purchased it. The color is nice, it immediately adds freshness to my complection. I like the matte formula, it is not crazily pigmented, so I can build it the way I like it, and it looks quite natural without crazy shine or sparkles. it lasts all day on my cheeks. I don't like the packaging though. The compact is hard to open, first time it opened it wrong way, the refill fell out and I almost returned my purchase, but then I managed to close the refill and opened it the right way. I was lazy to go to the store to exchange, and so far I can use it. I understand that for the price you can't expect a fancy packaging, but this one is particularly not user friendly.

review_content: The color of this is perfect for me. I love this blush. It's not too crazy pigmented right off the bat which I appreciate alot. Also, great price.

product_name: SEPHORA COLLECTION Colorful Face Powders – Blush, Bronze, Highlight, & Contour
user_specs: ['Eye Color Blue', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Porcelain', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_title: Great Contour Shade for Pale/Fair/Translucent Skin
review_content:
As someone with very fair/pale/translucent skin, finding a contour shade in a sea of “bronzers” and shades for golden goddesses has been an exhausting task. I thought I found a decent match in NYX’s “Taupe” as many an internet source had recommended, but if I’m honest “Taupe” still didn’t quite work with my undertones as it’s applies too orangey/yellow. When I saw Sephora’s “Second Chance” I was instantly drawn to this flattering light blushing taupe shade with a pinky undertone. When I applied it, I was even more impressed. YES SEPHORA! This is what I’ve been looking for! This is a way more natural looking contour (and still buildable for drama) if you find that even the lightest of other brands’ contour/taupe blushes/taupe eye shadows look too warm and “fake”, like an orange/yellow dirt smudge rather than a shadow in the the hollows of your facial structure. If you are an “Ice Queen” searching for something to make those cheekbones pop, give this a try.
